lines.content: Sss is a chatbot that allows users to manage multiple tasks, via a Command Line Interface
1. Ensure you have Java `17` or above installed in your computer.
1. Copy the file to any folder
1. Open a command terminal, `cd` into the folder and use `java -jar ShengJieip.jar`command to run the application
1. Refer to Features below for details of each command
Adds a todo task to the list of tracked tasks.
Adds a todo task to the list of tracked tasks.
Adds a todo task to the list of tracked tasks.
Lists all tasks that contains the keyword.
Sss saves all data in the hard disk automatically after any changes has been made to the data.
Sss data is saved automatically as a txt file [Jar file location]/saves/taskdata.txt

| **event** | `event TASK_DESCRIPTION /from STARTING_DATE /to ENDING_DATE`
e.g. `event attend lecture /from 6th Feb 5pm /to 6th Feb 7pm` |
* Executes the command based on its type
System.out.println("Please input an integer between 1 and " + TaskManager.getCounter());
Event eventTask = new Event(eventTaskDescription, eventFrom, eventTo);
System.out.println("Please input an integer between 1 and " + TaskManager.getCounter());
System.out.println("Please input an integer between 1 and " + TaskManager.getCounter());
* Signals that a invalid command has been provided to the chatbot
* Signals that there is an invalid or missing argument for the command
* A command handler to process the command given to the chatbot
* Constructs a command handler for further processing of the command. The arguments field should contain
* @param command A single word string that tells the chatbot what to do
* @param arguments An array of strings containing information to be used when processing the command
* @return false if bye command was used else true
* A file processor that saves and loads task from and to a txt file
* Saves tasks to a txt file which can be loaded again during the initalization of the chatbot
* Read tasks from a txt file saved by {@link #writeToFile(ArrayList) writeToFile} and load it
Task deadlineTask = new Deadline(description, by, isDone);
Task eventTask = new Event(description, from, to, isDone);
System.out.println("Added " + counter + " tasks based on previous records");
* An input parser to make sense of the user input
* Constructs a parser for the input of the user.
* @param input A string provided by the user
* Return the command in this input
* Return the arguments after processing the input with relation to the command
* @return A String array the contains the arguments needed to process the command
* A deadline task that stores the deadline of this task
* Constructs a deadline task with the description and time it should be completed by
* @param description A String to describe the task
* @param by A String with the Deadline of the task
public Deadline(String description, String by, boolean isDone){
* Return the deadline of this task specified by the user
* @return deadline to complete the task by
* An event task the stores the time of the event
* Constructs an event object with its description and the time of the event. from should
* contain the starting time of the event. to should contain the ending time of the event
* @param description A String the describe the event
* @param from A String to represent the starting time of the event
* @param to A String to represent the ending time of the event
public Event(String description, String from, String to){
public Event(String description, String from, String to, boolean isDone){
* Returns the starting time of the event
* Returns the ending time of the event
* Returns a String representation of this task. X representing if the task has been completed
* Sets the status of the task. doneStatus should be true if the task is completed false otherwise
* @param doneStatus boolean to show if the task is completed
* Return the description of the task
* Return whether the task is completed
* @return true if task is completed false otherwise
public static ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* Prints out all tasks that has been added
* Marks a task completed based on index
* @param index An integer to specify which task to mark
* Marks a task incomplete based on index
* @param index An integer to specify which task to unmark
* Returns a {@link Task} object based on the index
* @param index An integer to specify which task to return
* Append the newTask to the ArrayList
* @param newTask A task to be added to the list
* Saves the current list of tasks
* Return the number of tasks currently in the list
* Removing a task from the list based on the index
* @param index An integer to specify which task to remove
* A Todo task that saves the task to be completed
* Constructs a Todo task with it description
* @param description A String to describe the Todo task
iscontinueProgram = handler.processCommand(); //return false with bye command else true
System.out.println("Some valid commands are deadline, todo, event, list, mark, unmark, bye");
